ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine knew the question would be asked sooner or later, he just wanted to hear her ask. I don t know if I can, you seem distracted with me around. He

Lunarpine knew the question would be asked sooner or later, he just 
wanted to hear her ask. "I don't know if I can, you seem distracted 
with me around." He wasn't entirely serious but she needed to be kept 
in place. Lunarpine sensed her feelings toward him, those would have 
to be tossed aside before she could take him seriously."You can't be 
taught, you already have everything you need, you just need to 
download it from inside yourself." The wolf in him knew he couldn't 
teach her to fly, but he'd be slaged before he saw her quit on 
herself.

"The great leaders didn't get taught to be great, the great fighters 
weren't taught to fight, either it's there or it's not. I can't see 
your spark, so tell me, what are you, a lover, a fighter, a leader, a 
follwer? WHAT ARE YOU?"

That was the one question she had to overcome before she could reach 
her full potential.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> 
> She followed Lunarpine to the base.  She was very confused.  She 
> didn't know what was wrong with her.  She knew that she was n 
ormally 
> driven by her instincts.  Normally her logic circuits were helpful 
in 
> getting things accoumplished.  But since she met Lunarpine, her 
logic 
> circuits were going bonkers.  She decided to go to her quarters and 
> run diognostics.  She hoped a small wire waqs just loose and that 
> this confusion in her would easily be solved.  She ran her 
> diognostics.  She found no such wire.
> "Blast! Well, so much for an easy cure to this problem."
> She went out of her quarters.  She looked for Lunarpine.  When she 
> found him in the base, she walked up to him,"Uh, look.  I'm 
terrably 
> sorry for my behavoir earlier.  I was wrong.  I should have faced 
my 
> problems instead of running from them.  But I was wondering, since 
> you are a greater fighter than I,I was wondering if you could teach 
> me how to fight. I mean, you showed me that I could use a lot of 
> improvement on my technequ.  I was wondering if you could help me 
> help me to improve?" She looked into his eyes and took one step 
> closer to him, "Please?"
